intro: Fedia heterocarpa, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, orange berries that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, edible aril. Fedia heterocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional medicinal contexts.
